{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3117229,"name":"Tom Winter","username":"tomjwinter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tomjwinter/{size}/110664_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-06T17:04:23.509Z","cooked":"

The newest version of the Driver Station (version 23.0, Lib: 2023.1.1) does not seem to be detecting joysticks when it first starts up. Need to unplug the joysticks and plug them back in again and then they are detected, but if I start/stop the Driver Station again, the joysticks are no longer detected. This did not happen with the 2023 beta version. Rebooting laptop did not help. Tried using multiple Logitech joysticks and USB ports.

If I have two joysticks plugged in when the Drivers Station starts up, as soon as I remove one, the Drivers Station will detect the other one.

Anyone else having this issue? Not sure where to report bugs for Drivers Station.

Need to unplug the joysticks and plug them back in again and then they are detected

Did you try the rescan button? That worked for me.

I’m having the same issue with my Xbox controller. Navigating to the joystick tab in DS and clicking “rescan” and it would find it. I was attributing it the fact I’m running my DS on a windows VM on MacOS, that is proxying the USB device to the VM.

We’ve added this to the known issues page of the docs. Using either the rescan button or F1 (which is a shortcut to do the rescan) is a workaround.
